alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 10:58AM MDT until April 23 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Ashton affecting Spink County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Ashton. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the bridge 3 miles north and 1 1/2 mile east of Ashton At 15.0 feet, Significant amounts of farm land begin flooding * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 13.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM CDT Tuesday was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening by 800 PM CDT.
